results.title: Show girls
results.creator_credit: Meilan Lam, Barrie Angus McLean, David Verrall, Tamara Lynch and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: ‘Show Girls’ celebrates Montreal’s swinging Black jazz scene from the 1920’s to the 1960’s, when the city was wide open. Three women who danced in the legendary Black clubs of the day - Rockhead’s Paradise, The Terminal, Cafe St. Michel - share their unforgettable memories of life at the center of one of the world’s hottest jazz spots. From the Roaring Twenties, through the Second World War, and on into the golden era of clubs in the fifties and sixties, ‘Show Girls’ chronicles the lives of Bernice, Tina and Olga, mixing their memories with rarely seen footage of the era. Their stories are told against a backdrop of the fascinating social and political history that made Montreal a jazz and nightclub hotspot for decades. It is a story of song and dance, music and pride. (Award: Yorkton.) Narrated by Anthony Sherwood.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Meilan Lam, Barrie Angus McLean, David Verrall, Tamara Lynch and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Shout! the story of Johnny O'keefe
results.brief_description: Johnny O’Keefe, the man who almost single-handedly created the Australian rock`n’roll industry. The man who challenged the Americans and broke all the rules, and whose reward was the devotion of millions of fans for a generation. This is the true story - all the triumphs and all the tears that drove the man forward and ultimately to his tragic, untimely death in 1978. A must for everyone who was there.

results.title: Short vision
results.creator_credit: Joan Foldes, Peter Foldes and British Film Institute
results.brief_description: An experimental film: using a simple animation technique “A SHORT VISION” creates an imaginative and disturbing picture of atomic warfare. A “thing” suddenly appears in the sky, flying over countryside and cities and destroying all living things. All that finally remains is a single flame with a moth fluttering around it; and, after a moment, the flame devours the moth. Music by Matyas Seiber.

results.title: Short story
results.brief_description: Encourages discussion about how writers choose and select material and use language, using Irish writer Frank O’Connor’s short story “Masculine protest”, about a twelve-year-old runaway, as a basis for discussion.

results.title: Hunger nation
results.brief_description: This flash animation creates a dismal vision of the future. Effective use of repetition, perspective and scale creates the illusion of depth immersing the audience in an apocalyptic world. A skilfully restrained yet multilayered sound design combines with visual composition revealing confident use of the Flash program.

results.title: Perception
results.brief_description: This artful documentary is an elegant and graceful insight into skating culture. Skilful camerawork combines with rhythmic editing celebrating the thrills and spills of the scene and the camaraderie of its participants.

results.title: To and fro
results.brief_description: A beautifully executed Flash animation that depicts the universal and unrelenting search for love. Selective use of detail and highly skilled illustrative qualities employ sophisticated visual storytelling conventions to produce a powerful emotional response within an epic framework.

results.title: Short orders
results.creator_credit: Hal Roach, Percy Pembroke and Hal Roach Studios
results.brief_description: Stan Laurel stars in this silent film as a harried waiter who must deal with customers who have issues with the quality of the food and service in the restaurant. Various comic situations arise. Cast: Stan Laurel, Marie Mosquini, Eddie Baker, Jack Ackroyd, Mark Jones, George Rowe

results.title: Radio romance
results.brief_description: Radio romance is an endearing work which creates warmth through the subtle use of multiple narratives and the affable assured performance of the band. Camera work and editing confidently exploit the rich setting with the songline expertly supported by the light-hearted use of props. Music performed by Strange Country.

results.title: Just business
results.brief_description:
A drama of revenge and retribution demonstrating high production values to create a corporate world of greed and indifference. Controlled camera work, lighting and slick editing combine with assured direction of the actors to create tension as this disturbing tale reaches its climax.
WARNING: THIS FILM CONTAINS SCENES THAT MAY DISTURB SOME VIEWERS
